tweets.text: @ElectricityNW @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice Thanks - I believe we‚Äôre the other outage, which your site says 10pm-ish tonight! Thanks though

We currently have 17 #flood warnings and 40 #flood alerts in place across the #Yorkshire region.  For the latest details about the areas affected by #StormChristoph please visit the live national flood warning map at https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/SKf9a3ZAzl

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been out at Croston pumping station this afternoon.

Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/rTwvpdKuwB
Sounds like quality ‚Äòcompost‚Äô that. PAS 100 or a scam to get around active landfill tax? https://t.co/pMnMeceuej

Take care out there across @peakdistrict. Don‚Äôt drive through flood water and check your flood risk in your area with @EnvAgency at https://t.co/68lkWODra0  @Derbyshirecc @derbyshiredales @SheffCouncil @KirkleesCouncil @HighPeakBC @StaffMoorlandDC https://t.co/iuonchjWHy
You can find the latest flood warnings for England here https://t.co/iJprXxwlJT

Pretty full #Crossens nr #Southport. In part from @EnvAgencyNW pumping station running flat out to protect 1000‚Äôs home‚Äôs & reduce impact on large are of high quality farm land. #StormChristoph #floodaware https://t.co/UdvWWM1fyJ
The River Mersey at East Didsbury. This isn‚Äôt even peak level yet. @EnvAgencyNW  tell residents to sign up to flood alerts. #StormChristoph https://t.co/sTgYpfqKrE

#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo

The UK is losing ~100 ha of saltmarsh each year, that is insane!!! üò±Great work from @EssexWT_Rachel et al to reverse this in Essexüå±Look forward to working on this in the Solent soon with @MountainCD @JPrestonDiggles @EnvAgency @hambleharbour and others #CoastalFutures21 https://t.co/Sb7RiPal6a

Advice from @EnvAgencyNW:

#DoYouKnow what to do in flood? 

#StormChristoph will bring widespread flood alerts and warnings across the North West over the next few days. 

Check your flood risk here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/iKOfLuVBqn https://t.co/sAgyESMr1h

The River Loxley at ‚ÄòRowell Bridge level recorder‚Äô a few minutes ago. Swollen, turbulent, angry and still rising. Fingers crossed for the folk downstream of all this! You can check the river level every 15 minutes via @EnvAgency site here: https://t.co/5yC1Z9nYMZ https://t.co/PiN8KzH8fd

A flood warning has been issued by @EnvAgencyYNE for Brearley and Luddenden Foot.

River levels across the Upper Calder Catchment have risen as a result of this afternoon's heavy rainfall. Levels are now approaching the threshold where properties are expected to flood ‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/ppoHS5gEpW

urls.title: Charlotte Cross: Are we prepared for flooding in Covid times? | ITV News
urls.description: With the added challenge of a global pandemic, Environment Correspondent Charlotte Cross looks at how we're placed if we have another winter as wet as the last.

tweets.text:
It comes after I asked councils and the @EnvAgency at the end of last year how prepared we were if flooding struck again during the pandemic.

They all said yes.

Storm Christoph could be about to put that to the test.

https://t.co/aNkUCBF8gU

tweets.text:
There are a number of #flood alerts and flood warnings in place across the North West - check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

Our teams continue to monitor the situation and are ready to respond. https://t.co/u9TpFotMXF

Flood barriers have been going up in Ironbridge, Shropshire, today, as Storm Christoph threatens to cause flooding in areas along the River Severn.

Full story on @ITVCentral at 6pm https://t.co/tvgpBPrunf

Huge thanks to the @LeedsCC_News teams, elected members, partners and volunteers for joint efforts. More heavy rain incoming as set out below and watch @EnvAgencyYNE for flood alerts and warnings. https://t.co/ULjO11SpCU

We‚Äôre currently supporting our colleagues from @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire and¬†@EnvAgencyNW, evacuating a number of residents from Hayhurst Marina due to the flooding cause by #StormChristoph. #StaySafe https://t.co/VqH0A1WD5h

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text: @TownStroud @EnvAgency They also block locks paddles, the hydro electric inlet and soil weirs on the canal!

If your garden runs down to a river edge, please make sure that there are no objects close to the water's edge. @EnvAgency tell us that when the flood waters rise logs, pots and other garden items get swept into the rivers and block any of the conduits and low bridges downriver.

Our field teams have lorry‚Äôs loaded in preparation for potential deployment of barriers in the next few days #Stormchristoph .Incident preparedness by #TeamEA.‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å©‚Å¶@johncurtinEA‚Å© ‚Å¶@sarahchareEA‚Å© https://t.co/HC43HBdxFz

tweets.text:
Turn around, don't drown!

Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine, and just 15cm of moving water is enough to impact a small car.

Don't drive through floodwater.
@EnvAgency | @itvanglia | @itvweather https://t.co/Gt2T4L1Fj8

@PaulReevesEA @EnvAgencyMids Paul, Is it possible that Drakelow could rise 1/2 m and Clifton Bridge 1 m and Great Wilne pass its highest level but  the area from Willington through Shardlow remaining static ?
@DasOptimist @EnvAgencyNW Thanks Ramapithecus, have you informed @CheshirePolice as well about the problem as well? - Thanks, Andrew

Just caught up with @EnvAgencyNW incident team - for #Cumbria most river levels are falling.  More rain to come overnight, which is forecast to bring rivers back up to today's levels and then rain eases into weekend.  #TeamEA  monitoring for heavier showers and ready to respond

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

Only travel if it's essential, turn your headlights on and DO NOT attempt to drive through flood water - it only takes a small amount of water to seriously damage your engine, and puts you and others at risk
The sluicegates at Sale Ees have been opened. Thank you @EnvAgencyNW  @gmpolice @MCCChorlton @ManCityCouncil for keeping us safe @ChorltonPkLab @ChorltonVoice https://t.co/Znj0Ty0pkr
